STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980
February 6, 2023
HARRISON ROBERT GLOSS
Innerlink Transitional Living Program
1110 HOWARD ST,
SAGINAW, MI, 48601-2734
RE: License#: CB730201194
Innerlink Transitional Living Program
1110 HOWARD ST,
SAGINAW, MI, 48601-2734
Dear Mr. GLOSS:
Your license is renewed. It is valid only at your present address and is nontransferable.
If you move, please notify us at least 30 days in advance.
You will be receiving the license in the mail. Please review it for accuracy.
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
02/02/2023. The study has determined substantial compliance with applicable licensing
statutes and rules, sections of the contract and MISEP requirements. It should be noted
that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and your contract.
As indicated above substantial compliance has been established therefore, your license
is renewed.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (734) 395-0920.
Sincerely,
Mark Hunter, Licensing Consultant
enclosure

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except
for the following:
None
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility
is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements except for the following:
None

3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a MDHHS Contract violation. Please note
that there are additional MDHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional MDHHS
Contract/Policy requirements except for the following:
None

None

None
EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
VI. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
Not Applicable
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract and policy. It is
recommended that the facility be issued a renewal of their regular license.
